Package org.sopra.api.exercises.exercise4

Interface FordFulkerson<V>

public interface FordFulkerson<V>
This interface represents a Ford-Fulkerson algorithm for computing maximum flows in a flow network.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void augmentPath​(java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> path)
    Finds the minimum capacity along the given path and adds the minimum capacity to flow of each edges of the path.
    void findMaxFlow​(FlowGraph<V> graph, V start, V target)
    Computes the maximum flow in a flow network from start to target.
    java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> findPath​(V start, V end, ResidualGraph<V> graph)
    Finds the shortest path with remaining capacity using Breadth-First-Search (BFS) on a residual graph from start to end.

  • Method Details

    • findMaxFlow

      void findMaxFlow​(FlowGraph<V> graph, V start, V target)

      Computes the maximum flow in a flow network from start to target.

      Given a flow network and a pair of nodes start & target, the algorithm calculates a maximum flow from start to target in given network.

      Parameters:
      graph - Flow graph representing the flow network. Flows along edges in this graph will be set to max flows
      start - Source node
      target - Sink node
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - If start or target are not nodes in the graph

    • findPath

      java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> findPath​(V start, V end, ResidualGraph<V> graph)

      Finds the shortest path with remaining capacity using Breadth-First-Search (BFS) on a residual graph from start to end.

      A path is considered shorter than another path, if the number of edges in that path is lower.

      If a path with remaining capacity along the edges exists, a double ended queue containing the edges of the path is returned. The edges are ordered depending on their occurrence in the path starting with an edge to end as first entry, and therefore ending with an edges from start as last entry.

      If no path with remaining capacity along the edges exists null is returned.

      Parameters:
      start - Start node of the path
      end - End node of the path
      graph - Residual graph to search in
      Returns:
      Path (represented by a double ended queue) from the graph with ordering depending on occurrence in the path, or null if path with remaining capacity does not exist
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If at least one of the parameters is null

    • augmentPath

      void augmentPath​(java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> path)
      Finds the minimum capacity along the given path and adds the minimum capacity to flow of each edges of the path.
      Parameters:
      path - Augmented path (represented by a double ended queue) where minimum capacity of path is added to flow
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null
